description: The demolition of the existing building 29 Pitfield Street and the erection of a four storey above basement level building to provide commercial floorspace (Use Class E) at basement and ground floor levels and 4 No. self-contained residential units (Use Class C3) to the upper floors.
decision_conditions: <p><span id="docs-internal-guid-7a01141b-7fff-15bf-e731-470e4eeb520d"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">By reason of Unit 2 providing single-aspect accommodation, with the outlook from the living room enclosed by a winter garden, and it failing to have been demonstrated that passive ventilation would be achieved, and the unit not overheat, the unit would fail to provide high quality accommodation contrary to Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policy LP17 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020), and the guidance as contained within the </span><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">Mayor of Londonâs Housing Design Standards (2023)</span><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">.</span></span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-7583f133-7fff-4654-31bb-bec96334092b"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">The proposed development, by reason of a lack of provision of affordable housing, would fail to adequately contribute towards the provision of mixed and balanced communities and housing needs in the local area. As such, the development would not be consistent with Policies H4 and H5 of the London Plan (2021), Policies LP12 and LP13 of the LP33, and the Hackney </span><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-style: italic; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">S106 Planning Contributions Supplementary Planning Document (2020)</span><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">.</span></span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-58ee3669-7fff-1350-e361-7161841c39cf"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">In the absence of a Unilateral Undertaking or a Section 106 agreement securing appropriate mitigation by restricting future occupiers of the development from obtaining parking permits within the Controlled Parking Zone the proposed development would likely exacerbate existing parking stress and congestion on the surrounding highway network. The application is, therefore, contrary to Policy LP45 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020) and Policy T6 of the London Plan (2021). </span></span></p>

<p>I<span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10.5pt; white-space-collapse: preserve;">n the absence of a legal agreement securing the financial contribution towards carbon off-setting has not been submitted or completed, the proposal would therefore fail to secure sufficient energy efficiency measures and/or financial contribution towards carbon offsetting, the proposed development would result in an unacceptable level of carbon dioxide emissions, contrary to Policy LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020).</span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-f7ad5ecd-7fff-a65d-1fc5-5994b55bd3b6"><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">By reason of the irreversible harm caused to the locally listed building through its demolition, and its inappropriate replacement which by reason of its overall scale, form and massing and unsympathetic detailed design and materiality, would fail to respond to the character and appearance of the area and significance of the Pitfield Street Conservation Area. The proposed development would, therefore, result in less than substantial harm to the significance of the Pitfield Street Conservation Area and the setting of Grade II Listed Buildings 17-21 Pitfield Street. The less than substantial harm would not be outweighed by the public benefits of the proposal as required by paragraph 215 of the </span><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-variant-emoji: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">National Planning Policy Framework (2024). The proposed development would, therefore, conflict with Policies D1, D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), Policies LP1, LP3 and LP4 of the Hackney Local Plan (2020) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).</span></span></p>
